meanings.definition: The quality or state of being meager.
meanings.sent1: The meagernesses of the meal left everyone hungry.
meanings.sent2: Despite his hard work, the meagernesses of his salary made it difficult to make ends meet.
meanings.sent3: The meagernesses of the picnic spread made the ants look elsewhere for food.
meanings.sent4: Her garden displayed the meagernesses of the soil's fertility, producing only a few small vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The meagernesses of the water supply in the desert made survival a daily struggle.

meanings.sent1: The meagernesses of coins in his pocket were not enough to buy a snack.
meanings.sent2: She was disappointed by the meagernesses of gifts she received on her birthday.
meanings.sent3: The meagernesses of paint left on the palette forced the artist to be creative with colors.
meanings.sent4: The meagernesses of words in the letter conveyed more emotion than a lengthy message.
meanings.sent5: The meagernesses of time remaining before the deadline caused stress and urgency.
